definition: lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
dialect/language/speech
to tell to

sentences.english: Today, as your country well knows is a differnt day altogether.
sentences.chinese: 你們國家非常清楚今天可完全是不可同日而語了。

sentences.english: Because the quality is not the same.
sentences.chinese: 因爲質量不可同日而語。

sentences.english: I know that their tactics don't compare.
sentences.chinese: 我知道論兩人的戰術造詣，那是不可同日而語的。

sentences.english: Such views of nature and history of the orientation of positivism has been a huge difference.
sentences.chinese: 此種見解自然與實證主義史學的取向已不可同日而語。

sentences.english: Bob's talent is not to be named on the same day with Carl's.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃的才能與卡爾的才能不可同日而語。

definition: to fight alone (idiom)

lit. a cup of water on a burning cart of firewood (idiom); fig. an utterly inadequate measure

political relations
typography/printing business

lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
practical value
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc

to comprehend (new things) by analogy
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
